channel.title: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL
channel.description:
Alright so recently after botting 3 accounts for 1-2 weeks, I reached 99wc on one, 99 fishing on another, and 85 mining on another. So I was planning to cut magics, fish mantas and sharks, and mine runite and other shot with the last.
After about getting ~10m on my Wc pure, I get banned. I was like, "alright, I need to be more careful." Then I log onto my fishing skiller, and after about 3 minutes, BANNED. Now I have my mining pure with about 8-9m worth of coal, but I'm afraid if I log onto it it might be banned.
What should I do?
Also, question 2 is do you think Jagex waits for a good moment to ban you? Like, he WANTS you to work a shitload to get 99, and then once you do, ban.
DISCUSS:

item.title: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL
item.dc:creator: @patargangstar patargangstar
item.description:
@patargangstar wrote:

personally, been botting for a total of 5 years or so… still not banned… its like winning the lottery in reverse, we all know their “bot detection systems” = /facepalm/

Read full topic
item.source: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL

item.title: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL

@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:19, topic:397232”]Wouldn’t it be the best-planned conspiracy if it turned out Jagex owned RSBots.net? ~$20/bot, AND absolutely no loss of their $5/6 a month members?

Just a thought.[/quote] And they can even ban people if the economy is going downwards haha

item.title: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL
item.dc:creator: @Enigma1 Enigma_
item.description:
@Enigma1 wrote:

[quote=“vexx1345, post:44, topic:397232”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=494382.msg3619869#msg3619869 date=1307307199]

Certain things really jump out at Jagex.
Here are a few:

  1. Poorly written chat responders. IE; responds with the exact sentence multiple times.
  2. Accounts that achieve 99 in one skill, then immediately start on a other skill without stopping.
  3. Accounts which never buy things themselves, only gathering resources, selling and giving the money to another person.
  4. Getting stuck in a random for 6 hours, ofc.
  5. Black players, since they should not be able to afford internet.

No.5 made me laugh irl.

Lmao I started cracking up like crazy too.
[/quote]
this proves theres a little bit of racism in all of us.[/quote]

It stops the world from going brown.

Read full topic
item.source: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL

item.title: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“mason-, post:29, topic:397232”][quote author=Nexus_ link=topic=494382.msg3614257#msg3614257 date=1306848724]

Make a new account, bot it, be more careful, use a better script and talk sometimes.

And my question to you is, does Jagex ban you because you’ve been reported, or because they just look at logs?

I use the best possible bot that is also modified to use an auto talker (responds to chat messages and asks “so hows everyone doing” type of dialogues). I just don’t understand HOW they caught me. I guess they look at whose online for >50 hours… I was stupid to turn breaks off, I just wanted the 99 fast and get the gp for my pure.
[/quote]

wrong. Breaks = ban because it’s RIGHT on the second. You don’t break exactly at 12:00:00 as a human, return at 12:30:00 and break again at 1:00:00 until 1:30:00 it would be more 12:01:58 to 12:28:21 and what not. http://www.rsbots.net/forums/index.php?topic=190962.0[/quote]
very nice, most players probably do not even think of that

Read full topic
item.source: Does Jagex wait for the right moment to ban you? LOL
